channel.title: Help please with a few rsps creation issues
channel.description: First off. I am completely lost now days with rsps. I am 16 so not the best at this lol. I don't understand the whole cache system. See I place the cache I download into my dropbox and link it to whatever client I am using usually it is a client/source/cache package from website forums such as mopar/locus I follow directions and it just never loads the cache it freezes or just get an error. Also I am having trouble getting my servers online even if I manually extract my cache into my C drive I still cannot access the runescape server even from the initiall 127.0.0.1 which if I remember right should work at least for your own IP adress? All help is appriciated I know most people say if I cant figure some of this out not to do it at all but I enjoy this alot and we all have to start somewhere right? Any help please message me I can do Skype or team viewer as soon as I get the message. Even E-mailing is ok. I dont really have alot to offer anyone money wise but if you find yourself willing to help me start a 662 or any servers like that please let me know! ESPECIALLY on the whole cache system! I hope this was in the right section I am pretty sure it was! THANKS GUYS :)

item.title: Help please with a few rsps creation issues
item.dc:creator: @tomato721 tomato721
item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

yep the cache sometimes needs to be in the source folder/data/cache btw if u extract it to ur cache folder be shure its not a cache inside a cache folder e.g c:poo/server/data/cache/cache

btw im 14 actually :eek:

Read full topic
item.source: Help please with a few rsps creation issues

item.title: Help please with a few rsps creation issues
item.dc:creator: @xilit xilit
item.description:
@xilit wrote:

Were else do I learn? No tut helps all they do is go to portforwarding and downloading a source.

Read full topic
item.source: Help please with a few rsps creation issues

item.title: Help please with a few rsps creation issues
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

It’s not always true that the cache needs to be in the C: drive to work. My cache atm only works if it is in the client folder. And before you host, i suggest you get to know how to maintain and develope a server.

Read full topic
item.source: Help please with a few rsps creation issues

item.title: Help please with a few rsps creation issues
item.dc:creator: @xilit xilit
item.description:
@xilit wrote:

First off. I am completely lost now days with rsps. I am 16 so not the best at this lol. I don’t understand the whole cache system. See I place the cache I download into my dropbox and link it to whatever client I am using usually it is a client/source/cache package from website forums such as mopar/locus I follow directions and it just never loads the cache it freezes or just get an error. Also I am having trouble getting my servers online even if I manually extract my cache into my C drive I still cannot access the runescape server even from the initiall 127.0.0.1 which if I remember right should work at least for your own IP adress? All help is appriciated I know most people say if I cant figure some of this out not to do it at all but I enjoy this alot and we all have to start somewhere right? Any help please message me I can do Skype or team viewer as soon as I get the message. Even E-mailing is ok. I dont really have alot to offer anyone money wise but if you find yourself willing to help me start a 662 or any servers like that please let me know! ESPECIALLY on the whole cache system! I hope this was in the right section I am pretty sure it was! THANKS GUYS
